docs.snippet: For about 10 hours in 1980, the United States faced a nuclear threat of its own making after an airman performing maintenance on a Titan II missile dropped a 9-pound socket 70 feet, ripping a hole in a fuel tank and leading to an explosion that pr...
docs.lead_paragraph: For about 10 hours in 1980, the United States faced a nuclear threat of its own making after an airman performing maintenance on a Titan II missile dropped a 9-pound socket 70 feet, ripping a hole in a fuel tank and leading to an explosion that propelled a 9-megaton warhead out of the ground.

headline.main: PBS Explores 1980 Nuclear Threat Triggered by Socket Wrench
headline.print_headline: PBS Explores 1980 Nuclear Threat Triggered by Socket Wrench
